executive_summary: Mining, oil and gas machinery manufacturers have endured declines in recent years. The poor performance of various downstream markets, including gold, silver, iron ore and coal miners, have contributed to declines. Industry-wide revenue has been falling at a CAGR of 2.0% over the past five years to total an estimated $20.7 billion in 2024, including an estimated decrease of 1.8% in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Outbreak of COVID-19 Led to Massive Declines
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The outbreak of COVID-19 in 2020 led to considerable declines for mining, oil and gas machinery manufacturers.
Despite rising coal, mineral, oil and gas prices in 2021, manufacturers didn't rebound alongside mining output.
Steel prices falling over the past five years has somewhat enabled manufacturers to keep prices competitive.
A strong US dollar hindered export growth for manufacturers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While the price of oil and gas will normalize through the end of 2029, domestic production will continue to increase.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DOWNSTREAM MARKETS RECOVERING AND EXPANDING WILL BENEFIT MANUFACTURERS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Falling interest rates over the next five years will greatly benefit mining, oil and gas machinery manufacturers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Trade Conditions to Shift and Benefit Manufacturers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, mining, oil and gas machinery manufacturers will benefit from a declining US dollar.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Profit Will Grow as Material, Wage and Transport Costs Fall
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As fuel prices continue to normalize, mining, oil and gas manufacturers will enjoy heightened profit.
